relation: Great for these types of students
Students who enjoy smaller campuses and who want to grow not just academically but spiritually as well.
Live on campus if you can. Use the library and other resources to your advantage. Do not slack on your FOCUS assignments. Keep track of your chapel attendances.

Although pricey, it is well worth your money. Unlike other universities in California, at CBU you are guaranteed to find classes for you major and you do not have to worry about your major being impacted. Also, at CBU you will be addressed by your name and not a number.

I love the campus. I love it so much I am trying to see if I can live on campus next year. Everybody is so friendly and the campus is beautiful and it is also very clean. Being on campus, you will feel welcomed and you can feel the amount of faith that surrounds you.
The class rooms are small enough to get one-on-one time with the professor. All the professors have a strong grasp on the subject they are teaching and teach with a passion.

There are buildings that are still standing from when the school was founded in 1954, but they are all standing strong, and are diligently maintained.
